title.rendered: Social Media Management Tool: Your Virtual Post Manager

content.rendered:
Social media is a very good platform when it comes to make something popular in a particular region. You can target better audience and largest audience with one post but it needs to be managed. You have to be present at right time and the right place. Social Media Management (SMM) require a lot of practice and task to get the best result from it. Thanks to managing tool, now we can handle these post with ease and schedule them. This will help in reaching the audience at the right time.

But it is really hard to pick one because there are so many of them. So who do you trust? Don’t worry we have made a list for you. You can make a better choice from here. But when it comes to professional result, you will really need Social Media Management team to do that. We will be listing 6 tools for small to medium business. And 6 for enterprise size business into. Thanks to Alfred Lua (@alfred_lua on twitter) to make a spreadsheet of it. So lets the countdown begin.

1.Buffer

(A powerful social media management tool)

Buffer is one of best when it comes to the management tool. With this tool, you can manage your content well and measure your performance. With the help of this, you can team up and coordinate with your team member. This makes the contribution of your whole social media team. Also, it can schedule your posts and status with other.

Prize: Free Plan, $10, $99, $199 and $399 per month. Also, it gives you 14-day free trial packs.

Social Media: Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Google Plus, Instagram, Pinterest.

Main Products: Publish, Reply, Analyze.

2. Hootsuite

(A scheduled and simple Management Tool)

Hootsuite helps you stay active on your social accounts 24/7. It is a simple one to handle and take care so many social platforms. Also, Hootsuite has other integrated applications too. You can save your images to your favorite cloud service and tag friends. Also, it has a ROI analyzer too to make most out of your investment and keep track of organic traffic.

Prize: Free Plan, $19, $99, $499, Enterprise Membership. Beside this, it also provides a 30-day trial pack.

Social Media: Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Google Plus, Instagram, WordPress, YouTube, 100+ Partner Apps

Main Products: Ads, Amplify, Campaigns, Insights, Impacts.

3. Sprout Social

(A well suitable tool for all business)

A remarkable brand making tool to manage all your social accounts. It is a well suited management tool that everyone can work with. Sprout is available for small to medium to an enterprise like a business. It have a very interactive ROI and data graph that is very useful when it comes to make some decision.

Prize: $99, $149, $249 for per month per user. All this is available with 30 day trial period.

Social Media: Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Google, Instagram.

Main Products: Analytics, Smart Inbox, Publishing Tools, Social CRM.

4. AgoraPulse

(A tool to harness your social media presence and make it better)

When it comes to an affordable tool you can choose AgoraPulse. It has ability to harness your social activity. With it, you can customize renew your post circulation and repeat it as many time you want. It also has its own insight. Also, it allows you to collaborate with your team to make the best result. Manage your team, assign tasks to them.

Prize: $49, $99, $199, $299 per month with 15 day trial period.

Social Media: Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Google, Instagram.

Main Products: Social Inbox, Publishing, Monitoring, Reports, CRM, Facebook Content Apps

5. Sendible

(Get simplified and solid with this Tool)

With Sendible you can monitor your progress with the interactive monitoring. Not just that you can also convert this into a report with pre-designed templates to create a good impression on your superior. Also, it has different features like a unified inbox (one for all), content sharing, attractive reports and more productive tools to help.

Prize: $49, $199, $499, Enterprise Pricing.

Social Media: Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Google+, Instagram, WordPress, YouTube, Foursquare, Tumblr and more.

Main Products: Social Inbox, Publishing and Collaboration, Analytic, CRM and Listening.

What so ever tool you are using you always need a professional. You should take help of some social media manager who can do this in a better way. Because a tool is not everything if you don’t use it with a good strategy it will not give you anything. Social Media management tools are what you can do to make a good reach to your audience.
